paper_abstract: We establish the following complexity results for prefix Grobner bases in free monoid rings: 1. vertical bar R vertical bar . size(p) reduction steps are sufficient to normalize a given polynomial p w.r.t. a given right-normalized system R of prefix rules compatible with some total admissible well-founded ordering >. 2. O(vertical bar R vertical bar . size(R)) basic steps are sufficient to transform a given terminating system R of prefix rules into an equivalent right-normalized system. 3. O(vertical bar R vertical bar(2) - size(R)) basic steps are sufficient to decide whether or not a given terminating system,R of prefix rules is a prefix Grobner basis. The latter result answers an open question posed by Zeckzer (2000) [9]. (C) 2009 Elsevier B.V. All rights reserved.
paper_title: Some complexity results for prefix Grobner bases in free monoid rings
